themes: rising cost of living and property taxes driving out artists
impact of screen culture and digital isolation on arts engagement
critique of economic development framing for the arts
key_phrases: Property taxes are so high that artists can't afford to live here
too many ways to stay at home and not engage face-to-face
Arts that foster isolation of individuals or exist largely for screen-based entertainment are not healthy
It's a mistake to view arts through the lens of economic development
It should be like education: an investment we make to build our society
barriers_identified: prevalence of screen-based entertainment leading to social isolation
arts being valued primarily for economic development rather than societal investment
solutions_proposed: treat arts funding as an investment similar to education
